title: Unable to retrieve genesis ETH1.0 chain header: not found (Kintsugi / Geth and Nethermind)
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description Error appears after every connection to the ETH1 endpoint. Logs given for geth, but this happens with nethermind as well. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction `bazelisk run //beacon-chain -- --genesis-state ~/eth/kintsugi-prysm-geth/kintsugi-testnet/custom_config_data/genesis.ssz --datadir ~/eth/kintsugi-prysm-geth --http-web3provider=http://192.168.0.2:8549 --kintsugi-testnet --p2p-tcp-port 13440 --p2p-udp-port 13440 --p2p-host-ip "1.2.3.4" --monitoring-port 8082` ## üî• Error 

[2021-12-23 22:11:41]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=http://192.168.0.2:8549
[2021-12-23 22:11:41] ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve genesis ETH1.0 chain header: not found
[2021-12-23 22:11:48]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block blockRoot=0x1513b4fb... epoch=1707 finalizedEpoch=1705 finalizedRoot=0xe3547f74... parentRoot=0x1513b4fb... slot=54634 slotInEpoch=10 version=merge
[2021-12-23 22:11:48]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=34 slot=54634
[2021-12-23 22:11:56]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=http://192.168.0.2:8549
[2021-12-23 22:11:56] ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve genesis ETH1.0 chain header: not found
[2021-12-23 22:12:00]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block blockRoot=0x1deb2663... epoch=1707 finalizedEpoch=1705 finalizedRoot=0xe3547f74... parentRoot=0x1deb2663... slot=54635 slotInEpoch=11 version=merge
[2021-12-23 22:12:00]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=17 slot=54635
[2021-12-23 22:12:11]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=http://192.168.0.2:8549
[2021-12-23 22:12:12] ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve genesis ETH1.0 chain header: not found
[2021-12-23 22:12:12]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block blockRoot=0x6ddc8d6f... epoch=1707 finalizedEpoch=1705 finalizedRoot=0xe3547f74... parentRoot=0x6ddc8d6f... slot=54636 slotInEpoch=12 version=merge
[2021-12-23 22:12:12]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=17 slot=54636
[2021-12-23 22:12:19]  INFO p2p: Peer summary activePeers=46 inbound=16 outbound=30
[2021-12-23 22:12:24]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block blockRoot=0x143443ec... epoch=1707 finalizedEpoch=1705 finalizedRoot=0xe3547f74... parentRoot=0x143443ec... slot=54637 slotInEpoch=13 version=merge
[2021-12-23 22:12:24]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=17 slot=54637
[2021-12-23 22:12:27]  INFO powchain: Connected to eth1 proof-of-work chain endpoint=http://192.168.0.2:8549
[2021-12-23 22:12:27] ERROR powchain: Unable to retrieve genesis ETH1.0 chain header: not found
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Linux Mint 20.2
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
51ef502b04b286fe920aeaf06aa49c53ffabd754

@SeaMonkey82 This is a cosmetic error. It has no harm to running prysm beacon node and validator. The error shows up because the test net uses a fake deposit contract to bootstrap a large validator count. I've hided the error when `--kintsugi-testnet` flag is applied on the beacon node
